Dual Gate Device 1 11/26/2021
Device Fab: John C
Measurement: John C / Dmitry / jiaqi help too

Push the gate more, T = 23 K
Note: accidentally applied huge voltage to back gate with voltage amplifier. However, after rechecking back gate, it somehow looks ok

This device could possibly have mixed 1/2L signal on right side of contacts, but left should be pure bilayer. It is a bit hard to see the right edge of the flake because there is a fold in top gate graphite as well.

All contacts worked at room temperature, phase gets really bad at low T – hopefully gate can help or we might have to switch to two terminal.

Also, based on this plot and previous slide, it seems we are close to something more drastic happening. Might be worth pushing gate once we explore some other things.

Somehow the “bunny” features in Rxy are gone now, and the MRR is much more tunable. Is there a phase transition? Maybe optics can help?
Sign of MRR changes
Jiaqi: Looks like weak localization to WAL transition
John C: does that make sense? Since the negative MRR likely comes from layered AFM – and the shape of MRR does not look like WAL to me (but need to read more)

Do we want to have a look at negative MR dome emerging here?

Try to do lower T (30 K), repeat the same measurement:
